metadata.title: CVE-2022-29869 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
cifs-utils through 6.14, with verbose logging, can cause an information leak when a file contains = (equal sign) characters but is not a valid credentials file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-29869` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

cifs-utils - 2:6.14-1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: cifs-utils package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:6.14-1.1').
